item.title: Building a Heavy-Duty Levelling Spreader Bar
item.description: We’re building one seriously heavy duty spreader bar for a skid steer and you know we don’t hold back when it comes to strength and durability

media:content.media:title: Building a Heavy-Duty Levelling Spreader Bar
media:content.media:description: We’re building one seriously heavy duty spreader bar for a skid steer and you know we don’t hold back when it comes to strength and durability

item.title: Engine Cover Assembled! *Franna Crane Project*
item.description: The new plates are finally here, so we can finish assembling the engine and transmission covers. With that sorted the next job is the tail light fabrication. We decided to use the existing horizontal light pockets which meant drilling right through the counterweight to clear out the old wiring hole.

item.title: These Rusted Sleeves Need to Be Replaced
item.description: One wrong move and we’re scrapping a part worth thousands! This week we’re working on a pair of track adjuster cannons from a Caterpillar D10 Dozer track frame, with bearing sleeves that are rusted, damaged, and well past their use-by date.

item.title: Firing Up The Klopp 1000H Shaper
item.description: This might just be the biggest metal hydraulic shaper! We are finally getting our big Klopp 1000H Shaper out of storage and moved into the workshop.
